titleStmt.title: Thomas H. Hulbert to James L. Page
CWG1756

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
E. A. THOMPSON.
T. A. NESMITH.
Law and Collection Office
-- OF --
THOMPSON & NESMITH,
ATTORNEYS AT LAW,
NO. 25 WEST THIRD ST., CINCINNATI.
For the Collection of Claims and the transaction of Legal Business in all parts of the United States and Canadas.
Cincinnati, February 8 1864

Jas. S. Page
Asst Sec. of State
Frankfort, Ky.
Dear Sir:

Yours of the 13th ultimo was recd: stating that my references, for Commissioner of Deeds for Kentucky, were satisfactory; and that upon the receipt of $500 statutory tax, my commission would be forwarded.
Enclosed find $5 U.S. Treasury note, Please foward my commission as early as possible, and oblige

Your Oby Servant
Thomas W. Hulbert

Ohio
Thos W. Hulbert
Appt Commr
of Deeds
9th Feby 1864
